He was the first of the seven popes who lived in Avignon in France. ==Early life== Bertrand de Got was born around 1264 in Villandraut in Gironde region of France. "Pope Clement V," Catholic Encyclopedia; retrieved 2012-3-15. ==Bishop== Betrand was Archbishop of Bordeaux. ==Pope== He was elected pope on June 5, 1305; and he chose to be called Clement V. He was the fourth of six non-cardinals to be elected pope in the Middle Ages. Cardinals of the Holy Roman Church , Conclaves of the 14th Century (1304-1394); retrieved 2012-3-15. Pope Clement moved the papacy to Avignon.
